coreConcepts
Interface Metric<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type over which the metric operates
All Known Subinterfaces:
MetricWithThreshold<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
MetricSpace, SEDCartesianPointByComplexity, SEDCartesianPointWithThreshold
public interface Metric<T>

Author:
Richard Connor an interface describing a distance metric, normally used with the intent of creating a MetricSpace object. Note that this should be a true metric otherwise some other classes will not function correctly

Method Summary
 double distance(T x, T y)
          the distance function of the metric this should be a proper metric, ie a positive function with symmetry, psuedo-identity and triangle inequality over the space of type T objects
 java.lang.String getMetricName()
          it is important to give a useful name here so that the output of experimental systems is correctly interpreted
 

Method Detail

distance

double distance(T x,
                T y)
the distance function of the metric this should be a proper metric, ie a positive function with symmetry, psuedo-identity and triangle inequality over the space of type T objects

Parameters:
x - the first parameter
y - the second parameter
Returns:
the distance between the parameters

getMetricName

java.lang.String getMetricName()
it is important to give a useful name here so that the output of experimental systems is correctly interpreted

Returns:
a name for a metric
